title: Property Investors Target Small Businesses as Market Heats Up
sub_head: Gas stations, grocery stores draw interest from venture-backed startups
body:
Some real-estate investors looking for the next big thing are turning to small businesses.
A new breed of property firms is buying up buildings occupied by gas stations, doctorsâ€™ offices and corner grocery stores. They see an opening because big asset managers typically avoid these properties, which they consider risky.
